H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H7454.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H732.def: = to make a journey of some length

H7252.def: = action by which humans assume a horizontal position

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6696.def: = causative action by which humans attach one or more objects to another object that contains an opening ► in order to block entry and/or exit

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

12.gl: to lay (one's) hand > to impose (one's) authority (on someone)

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6383.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H575.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5266.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3331.def: = causative action by which humans spread out a cloth on the floor or a bed with the intention of sleeping on top of it

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H7779.def: = causative action by which animals, humans and, by extension, deities cause serious physical damage to the body of a human being or animal

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2825.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, and fear

H219.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H6395.def: = state in which one group of people differs from another

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6108.def: = the framework of bones supporting the human body

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7551.def: = person whose profession it is to sew decorative patterns into cloth

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1564.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = an unborn child, possibly described as something that is rolled up and about to unfold

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3365.def: = state in which humans are valuable and worthy of respect in the eyes of others

H7454.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H2344.def: = minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea-shore, river-beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6991.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause people to die

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

2.gl: if only ... (I would be so happy!)

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H6145.def: possibly Israelite Hebrew and Aramaic; = person that is one's opponent in daily life or in battle; ≈ associated with causing people anguish and distress

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6962.def: = to experience a deep loathing for a person or condition

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H974.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H8312.def: = process by which the mind of humans is filled with distressing thoughts

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6090.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
